summary: This document is an email chain from November 16, 2020, between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, and an Assistant United States Attorney. The primary subject is Sternheim's request to move her client, Maxwell, to a different cell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off, and a logistical discussion about delivering a laptop for Maxwell to review discovery materials.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office to request better conditions for her client at MDC and discuss logistics for discovery review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated client of Bobbi Sternheim, held at MDC under registration number 02879-509. The emails concern her detention conditions and legal discovery process.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An unnamed prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is coordinating with Maxwell's defense regarding logistics, including delivering a laptop for discovery review.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as legal counsel for Maxwell, advocating for her client's welfare and facilitating her legal defense.
Professional correspondence between defense and prosecution regarding case logistics and defendant's conditions.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Maxwell's Detention
events.description: Email exchange regarding a request to move Ghislaine Maxwell to a different cell due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off at MDC, and coordination to deliver a laptop for her discovery review.

events.title: Previous Notification on MDC Utilities
events.description: Prior notification from the City indicating the water and heat would not be shut off at MDC, as referenced in the email chain.

events.title: Scheduled MDC Water/Heat Shut-off
events.description: Planned disruption of water and heat at the Metropolitan Detention Center from 9:00 pm to 5:00 am, prompting the defense's request for client relocation.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
33 West 19th Street, 4th Floor, New York, NY 10011 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) under registration number 02879-509 as of November 2020.
Maxwell's attorney, Bobbi Sternheim, requested she be moved from an isolation cell with two exterior walls to an interior cell due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off at the facility.
A court order permitted Maxwell to review discovery materials in a dayroom cell from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm.
The prosecution and defense were coordinating the delivery of a laptop to Maxwell for her to use while reviewing discovery.
The correspondence shows active legal proceedings and concerns about Maxwell's detention conditions during her pre-trial incarceration.
